intro: Xanthisma stenolobum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with hairy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Xanthisma stenolobum thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems, providing habitat and forage for various wildlife species.
